resolver.text: Section 3 - Household Contents and Personal Belongings (Overseas)
Covers legal liability of the insured student towards third party for accidental injury or property damage, as well as any associated legal costs and expenses

Covers irrecoverable school fees or deposits if the insured student is prevented from continuing his/her study due to hospital confinement for over 30 days, serious injury, sickness, paralysis, or death of an immediate family member
Section 6 - Travel Delay and Additional Benefits*

I HEREBY CONFIRM THAT I AM NOT ACTING ON BEHALF OF ANY OTHER PERSON FOR THIS INSURANCE APPLICATION UNLESS OTHERWISE EXPRESSLY INDICATED IN THIS PROPOSAL FORM OR ANY OTHER DOCUMENTS PROVIDED TO THE COMPANY FOR THIS APPLICATION. I HEREBY DECLARE AND AGREE ON BEHALF OF MYSELF AND OTHER PERSONS REFERRED TO IN THIS APPLICATION (HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS “RELEVANT PERSONS”) (FOR THE AVOIDANCE OF DOUBT, THE EXPRESSION “RELEVANT PERSONS” INCLUDE MYSELF AND SUCH OTHER PERSONS) THAT 1. THE INSURED STUDENT IS IN GOOD HEALTH, AND WILL NOT BE TRAVELLING CONTRARY TO THE ADVICE OF MEDICAL PRACTITIONER, AND/OR FOR THE PURPOSE OF OBTAINING MEDICAL TREATMENT OR FOR MIGRATION, AND/OR ENGAGING IN ANY MANUAL WORK DURING THE PERIOD OF INSURANCE. 2. THE INSURED STUDENT DOES NOT HAVE PHYSICAL IMPAIRMENT OR MENTAL DEFICIENCY, AND HAS NEVER BEEN TREATED FOR OR EXAMINED THAT HE/SHE HAS ABNORMAL BLOOD PRESSURE, ULCERS, TUBERCULOSIS, MENTAL DISORDER, THROMBOSIS, HERNIA, DIABETES, CANCER, VARICOSE VEINS, VENEREAL DISEASE, PARALYSIS, ARTHRITIS, RHEUMATISM, ANY DISORDER OF DISEASE OF NERVOUS, GENITO-URINARY SYSTEM, SPINE OR HEART. 3. ALL STATEMENTS AND ANSWERS TO ALL QUESTIONS WHETHER OR NOT WRITTEN BY MY/OUR OWN HAND ARE TO THE BEST OF MY KNOWLEDGE AND BELIEF COMPLETE AND TRUE; 4. ALL ANSWERS TO SUCH QUESTIONS, TOGETHER WITH THIS APPLICATION, SHALL FORM THE BASIS AND BECOME A PART OF THE POLICY; 5. I HAVE READ AND FULLY UNDERSTOOD THE PRINCIPAL BROCHURE FOR THE POLICY APPLIED FOR; 6. I SHALL DISCLOSE TO THE COMPANY ANY CHANGE AND/OR MATERIAL FACTS OF ALL RELEVANT PERSON(S) THAT OCCUR AFTER SIGNING THIS PROPOSAL FORM BUT BEFORE THE POLICY IS ISSUED;    7. THE POLICY SHALL BE EFFECTIVE ONLY FOLLOWING THE FULL PAYMENT OF PREMIUM STATED IN THE POLICY SCHEDULE AND ALL APPLICABLE REQUIREMENTS BEING MET; 8. THE COMPANY IS NOT BOUND BY AND IS NOT REQUIRED TO RELY ON ANY STATEMENT WHICH I MAY HAVE MADE TO ANY PERSON IF NOT WRITTEN OR PRINTED HERE. 9. THE INSURED STUDENT AND I DO NOT HAVE ANY ADDRESS OR RESIDENCE IN JAPAN. 10. COMMISSION DISCLOSURE DECLARATION (THIS PARAGRAPH IS ONLY APPLICABLE IF I HAVE APPOINTED A BROKER IN THIS INSURANCE APPLICATION) I UNDERSTAND, ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT, AS A RESULT OF MY PURCHASING AND TAKING UP THE POLICY TO BE ISSUED BY AXA GENERAL INSURANCE HONG KONG LIMITED (THE “COMPANY”), THE COMPANY WILL PAY THE AUTHORIZED INSURANCE BROKER COMMISSION DURING THE CONTINUANCE OF THE POLICY INCLUDING RENEWALS AND/OR PAYING ADDITIONAL PREMIUM, FOR ARRANGING THE SAID POLICY. WHERE I AM A BODY CORPORATE, THE AUTHORIZED PERSON WHO SIGNS ON MY BEHALF FURTHER CONFIRMS TO THE COMPANY THAT HE OR SHE IS AUTHORIZED TO DO SO. I FURTHER UNDERSTAND THAT THE ABOVE AGREEMENT IS NECESSARY FOR THE COMPANY TO PROCEED WITH THE APPLICATION. I DECLARE THAT THE INSURED STUDENT IS A FULL TIME OVERSEAS STUDENT (ATTENDING DAY COURSES) AND IS NOT TRAVELLING CONTRARY TO THE ADVICE OF A MEDICAL PRACTITIONER, OR NOT ENGAGING IN ANY MANUAL WORK DURING THE INSURING PERIOD. NO INSURER HAS EVER CANCELLED, DECLINED, REFUSED TO RENEW OR IMPOSED SPECIAL TERMS OR CONDITIONS ON ANY MEDICAL, TRAVEL AND/OR OVERSEAS STUDENT INSURANCE POLICY HELD BY MYSELF/INSURED STUDENT. I HAVE NOT WITHHELD ANY MATERIAL INFORMATION AND ACCEPT THAT THIS PROPOSAL AND DECLARATION SHALL BE THE BASIS OF, AND BE INCORPORATED IN, THE CONTRACT BETWEEN AXA GENERAL INSURANCE HONG KONG LIMITED AND MYSELF/INSURED STUDENT. I HEREBY DECLARE AND AGREE THAT I HAVE THE FULL AUTHORITY FROM AND CONSENT OF THE RELEVANT PERSON(S) TO MAKE THE ABOVE ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS, DECLARATIONS, AGREEMENTS AND AUTHORISATIONS.

IMPORTANT NOTE Please advise AXA immediately after receiving this policy schedule if you do not agree with any of the application information and declaration, or if any of the policy information is not correct. If you applied for this policy through an insurance intermediary, your insurance intermediary has provided the information and made the declaration to AXA for and on your behalf.

I UNDERSTAND AND AGREE TO THE AUTOMATIC RENEWAL ARRANGEMENT, IN WHICH THE REQUIRED RENEWAL INSURANCE PREMIUM AND LEVY IN ALL SUBSEQUENT RENEWALS WILL BE DEBITED ANNUALLY FROM THE DESIGNATED CREDIT CARD ACCOUNT WHICH I HAVE PROVIDED IN THIS INSURANCE APPLICATION. 1. SUBJECT TO (4) BELOW, MY POLICY WILL BE RENEWED AUTOMATICALLY ON AN ANNUAL BASIS ON SUCH TERMS AND PREMIUM WHICH IS ADJUSTED PURSUANT TO (2) BELOW AND AS SET OUT IN THE RENEWAL NOTICE SENT BY HONG KONG BROADBAND NETWORK LIMITED (“HKBN”) AS INSURANCE AGENT OF AXA GENERAL INSURANCE HONG KONG LIMITED (“AXA”) OR BY AXA DIRECTLY. 2. ADJUSTMENTS IN THE PREMIUM RATE, EXCESS AND OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF MY POLICY WILL, WHERE APPLICABLE, BE AUTOMATICALLY MADE UPON POLICY RENEWAL AT THE REQUEST OF AXA. 3. THE REQUIRED RENEWAL INSURANCE PREMIUM AND LEVY IN ALL SUBSEQUENT RENEWALS WILL BE DEBITED ANNUALLY FROM THE DESIGNATED CREDIT CARD ACCOUNT WHICH I HAVE PROVIDED IN THIS INSURANCE APPLICATION. 4. NO AUTOMATIC RENEWAL SHALL OPERATE IF HKBN/AXA CONSIDERS IT APPROPRIATE TO CEASE THE OPERATION OF AUTOMATIC RENEWAL UNDER MY POLICY. 5. I MUST INFORM AXA AS SOON AS REASONABLY PRACTICABLE IN WRITING OF ANY MATERIAL CHANGE IN THE RISK INSURED HEREUNDER DURING THE PERIOD OF INSURANCE UNDER MY POLICY INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE INSURED ADDRESS CHANGE, OR ANY CLAIMS INCURRED (INCLUDING THOSE NOT YET REPORTED TO AXA).
Covers inpatient and outpatient expenses of the insured student for accident or sickness occurring during the study trip
Covers reasonable charges for burial, cremation or funeral expenses in the locality of where the death happens
(a) Covers follow up medical expenses in Hong Kong within 90 days of return from abroad
(b) Provides cash allowance if the insured student is confined to intensive care unit

Pays for economy class tickets and accommodation for spouse, parents or children to visit the insured student who is hospitalised for more than 5 consecutive days or in event of the insured student’s death
Offers cash benefit for parents or guardian who take annual leave to visit the insured student who is hospitalised for more than 5 consecutive days

Covers the transportation cost for follow-up treatment

or rehabilitation training, if the insured student has been confined to hospital for more than 5 consecutive days
"3,000 (300 per ride, 2 rides per visit per day)"
Covers trauma counselling if the insured student is a witness or victim of a traumatic event
Covers accommodation expenses for the insured student’s overseas convalescence after discharge from hospital
Provides cash relief in the event of the insured student’s death due to sudden sickness outside Hong Kong
Personal accident of the insured student
(1) Accidental death or permanent disablement on common carrier (not applicable for age under 18)
(2) Accidental death or permanent disablement due to kidnap
(3) Accidental death or permanent disablement due to natural disaster
(4) Broken bones as a result of an accidental injury
Provides a subsidy to ensure the continuation of education in the event that the insured student’s parent/guardian suffers accidental death or permanent disablement

Household contents at residence overseas Covers for loss or damage of household contents in the insured student’s residence overseas resulted from fire, flood, earthquake, tsunami, subsidence/landslip, aircraft damage or impact damage by any road vehicle
Pays for temporary accommodation at a hotel, lodging house or boarding house if the insured student’s residence overseas is damaged and rendered uninhabitable
Covers for loss or damage of personal belongings while the insured student is travelling outside Hong Kong
Covers monetary loss caused by unauthorised use of credit cards in the event of loss of cards by robbery or theft (not applicable for age under 16)
Covers travel document replacement costs, and additional transportation and accommodation expenses
Provides cash allowance for unexpected school closure for more than 3 consecutive days due to natural disaster or as mandated by local authority

Covers storage cost for the personal belongings of the insured student who needs to take emergency departure due to natural disaster within the vicinity of the school, or as mandated by local authority

Covers strike or other industrial action, riot, civil commotion, hijacks, acts of terrorism, natural disasters, adverse weather conditions, mechanical and/or electrical breakdown of the common carrier or closure of the airport
(a) Cash allowance for the delay of departure of scheduled transportations
"3,000 per trip (300 first 5 hours, 500 every 5 hours thereafter)"
(b) Additional transportation expenses and overseas overnight accommodation incurred for the delay of more than 5 hours
Covers the cost of emergency purchases of clothing, requisites or toiletries if the baggage is delayed due to mishandling by the airlines or hi-jack
"2,000 per trip (500 first 5 hours, 1,000 every 5 hours thereafter)"

Covers the event of sudden death, serious injury or sickness of the insured student, an immediate family member or travel companion, strike, riot, civil commotion, acts of terrorism, red or black outbound travel alert (except for the reason of pandemic), natural disaster, adverse weather conditions, or other insured events
Covers irrecoverable transportation and accommodation expenses paid in advance
Covers cancellation fee of redeemed air mileage or provides cash allowance for non-refundable air mileage redeemed for transportation and accommodation

Covers the event of sudden death, serious injury or sickness of the insured student, an immediate family member or travel companion, strike, riot, civil commotion, acts of terrorism, red or black outbound travel alert, natural disaster, adverse weather conditions, or other insured events
Covers irrecoverable loss of or additional transportation and accommodation expenses
Covers cancellation fee of redeemed air mileage or provides cash allowance on non-refundable air mileage redeemed for transportation and accommodation
Covers additional transportation and overnight accommodation expenses incurred due to late arrival of incoming connection flight and no onward transportation is available within 5 consecutive hours

Covers the same events as of Section 6.1 Covers additional transportation expenses in re-routing to arrive at the scheduled destination if common carrier is cancelled or delayed for more than 5 consecutive hours

* The maximum limit of indemnity under Section 6.1, 6.2, 6.3, 6.4, 6.5 and 6.6 means the total amount of money payable for all claims in aggregate “per trip” during the Study Trip within any one period of insurance.
Section 3 - Household Contents and Personal Belongings (Overseas)
Covers legal liability of the insured student towards third party for accidental injury or property damage, as well as any associated legal costs and expenses

Covers irrecoverable school fees or deposits if the insured student is prevented from continuing his/her study due to hospital confinement for over 30 days, serious injury, sickness, paralysis, or death of an immediate family member
Section 6 - Travel Delay and Additional Benefits*

Insured age does not fall in the allowed range.
Policy holder age does not fall in the allowed range.
